page.title: 16Village Church (Part 1)
page.content: {St Mary's}church{Hope-under-Dinmore, stands at the{foot}of the northern- most limit of{Dinmore Hill.}A church has stood here for hundreds of years. The 14th century{nave}was drastically {restored}in{1879}when the North Transept was added.The{Chancel}was {rebuilt}in{1896.}The 3 storeyed west {tower}is{18th century. 3}Church{bells at the top.On the floor below them is a{7 day clock mechanism.}The clock was installed to commemorate 4 men of the parish who died in the 1914-1918 war. It was made by Gillett & Johnston of Croydon.Clock number 9134 has to be wound every 6 days.It has the same type of mechanism as Big Ben,London. Our clock has{2 faces.}One is on the west wall of the tower.The second is on the north wall.The black faces have gold Roman numerals.The{chimes, inaudible in the village,are{not used.
